keyword: jack in the box tacos calories
title: Calories in Jack in the Box Tacos
meta_description: Discover jack in the box tacos calories for a standard 2-taco serving, including macros, sodium, and quick tweaks for your fast-food fix.
h1: Calories in Jack in the Box Tacos
assumptions: Standard crunchy tacos with seasoned beef, cheddar cheese, shredded lettuce, and mild taco sauce; as served at Jack in the Box.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, portion size, and customizations. Check the Jack in the Box app or menu for latest values.

quick_answer.text: Two Jack in the Box tacos provide ~286 kcal, 14 g protein, and 706 mg sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with fast-food info.

tweaks.label: Vegetarian version with beans instead of beef (per taco)

faqs.q: How many calories in one Jack in the Box taco?
What are the macros for Jack in the Box tacos calories?
faqs.a: For two tacos: 22 g carbs, 14 g protein, 16 g fat.

faqs.q: Are Jack in the Box tacos high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, two tacos have ~706 mg sodiumâ€”over 30% of daily recommended intake.

faqs.q: How do Jack in the Box tacos compare to other fast-food tacos?
faqs.a: Similar to Taco Bell's crunchy taco at ~140-170 kcal each, but varies by fillings.

faqs.q: Can I make Jack in the Box tacos lower calorie?
faqs.a: Skip the sauce or cheese to reduce by 10-50 kcal per taco.
